cont.entity_a: Solid body with superior build quality compared to Canon Rebel series. Pro body with weather sealing and built-in hand grip.
cont.entity_b: Compact and easy to handle body.

cont.entity_a: 8fps shooting speed is impressive for a 10-year-old camera.
cont.entity_b: Fast response time with continuous shooting at 3fps.

cont.entity_a: Pro autofocus with 45 points and AI Servo Mode prevents losing subjects. Fast autofocus performance with a suitable lens.
Low resolution at 4.2MP is a limitation for some users.
Difficult to find accessories due to the camera's age.
cont.entity_b: Missing CF card and incompatible USB cable are issues.

cont.entity_a: Error 99 is a known issue with this camera model.

cont.entity_b: Compatible with older Minolta lenses, providing cost savings. The camera has a full-sized CCD and compatibility with Sony and Konica-Minolta lenses.
Relatively easy to use with intuitive controls. Notable for its ease of use and exceptional performance.
Anti-shake feature enhances image stability. Image stabilization feature is beneficial for sharp photos.
Great for basic photography with good picture quality. Excellent for close-ups but limited in certain conditions.
Vivid colors and terrific clarity in photos.
Plenty of lens options available second-hand.
Sony's proprietary hot shoe limits flash options.

cont.entity_a: Time has passed this camera by, with newer DSLRs offering better value.
